Acts:15:28.text: For it hath seemed good concilially, to the Holy Ghost and to us, to lay no further burden upon you than these necessary things:
footnotes: Greek: ἔδοξεν γὰρ τῷ πνεύματι τῷ ἁγίῳ καὶ ἡμῖν — 'For it seemed good to the Holy Spirit and to us.'

The addition of 'concilially' clarifies the methodological context: the apostolic decision was rendered through conciliar deliberation under the guidance of the Holy Spirit, establishing the paradigm for ecumenical councils.
